org.iot.dsa.io

Class DSCharBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.iot.dsa.io.DSCharBuffer

  • public class DSCharBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A buffer for storing chars being pushed from a reader. Useful when chars are coming in faster than can be processed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DSCharBuffer() 
      DSCharBuffer(int initialCapacity)

        Number of millis the read methods will block before throwing an IOException.
        Returns:
        Zero or less is indefinite.

      • put

        public void put(char[] msg,
                int off,
                int len)
        Add chars to the buffer for reading.
        Parameters:
        msg - The data source.
        off - The start offset in the buffer to put data.
        len - The maximum number of chars to read.

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String msg)
        Add chars to the buffer for reading.

      • read

        public int read()
        Returns the next incoming char, or -1 when end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        DSIoException - if there are any issues.

      • read

        public int read(char[] buf,
                int off,
                int len)
        Reads incoming chars into the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer into which data is read.
        off - The start offset in the buffer to put data.
        len - The maximum number of chars to read.
        Returns:
        The number of chars read or -1 for end of stream.
        Throws:
        DSIoException - if there are any issues.

      • setTimeout

        public DSCharBuffer setTimeout(long timeout)
        Number of millis the read methods will block before throwing an DSIoException.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Zero or less for indefinite.
        Returns:
        This
